definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: The Bible often compares trials to a metal refiner's fire that burns away the impurities.
sentences.chinese: 聖經常用金匠煉淨雜質的爐火來比喻考驗。

sentences.english: The goldsmith gave him three hundred talers, and remained a hundred in his debt.
sentences.chinese: 於是，金匠給了他三百個銀幣，還欠他一百。

sentences.english: I asked the goldsmith if he could make me a ring out of the necklace.
sentences.chinese: 我問這個金匠能不能把項鍊改成戒指。

sentences.english: And between the high chamber of the corner and the Sheep Gate repairs were carried out by the goldsmiths and the merchants.
sentences.chinese: 由城角堡至羊門中間的一段，歸金匠和商人修理。

sentences.english: Banking in the British Isles originated with the London goldsmiths of the 16th century.
sentences.chinese: 不列顛羣島的銀行業起源於16世紀倫敦的金匠商人。

sentences.english: The greedy goldsmith was found guilty and was executed.
sentences.chinese: 貪婪的金匠被判決有罪，受到懲處。

definition: fellmonger/a dealer who works with animal hides and skins
